history.text: Hi, How are you?
I'm good! How about you?
Doing great, what did you think about Bruce Almighty?
I thought it was a great movie! I don't understand why it only got a 46% on Rotten Tomatoes.
Honestly, I think Rotten Tomatoes is really biased against certain movies.
It doesn't surprise me they rated it so low.
I mean Jim Carry was banned from Egypt because of the film.
That's strange. It's clearly a comedy and Jim Carrey is known for comedy.
Yes, but people are very uptight about religion.
I think if the movie was released in our current time , it would of been boycotted
I personally would rate the film a solid 8, what about you?
I'd probably also give the film an 8/10. It has a lot of replay value, and the jokes have not soured over time.
Who do you think was a better actor in the movie, Jim Carrey or Morgan Freeman?
That is a really tough question, because I really liked both of their performances.
They were really both convincing, but if I had to pick I'd say Jimm won by a small margrine
As much as I like Jim, I think another comedian could have done an equally good job. Morgan has since been defined by his role of god, since his voice is very fitting.
What did you think of Jennifer Aniston as the girlfriend?
Morgan's voice will always be iconic. The guy could literally narrate what we are doing now and it would sound fantastic.
She was pretty forgettable actually. I was so focused on Jim, Morgan and the story that I often forgot about her. How about you?
I felt like she wasn't terribly believable, especially since Bruce/Jim seemed interested in Susan. Jennifer is not someone to be turned down.
That meteor scene was pretty hilarious though, with the cook off nearby.
Yeah, sometimes I wonder how she gets the roles she does.
Lol, yeah I really liked he meteor scene
Which "miracle" did you like the best?
I also liked when Jim first discovered his powers.
I'd say scene wish I liked it when Bruce was messing with Evan during the news broadcast.
I literally lose it every time I see that scene
Me too!
Steve does such a great job pretending to be controlled.
I also like when they first met, there was a lot of meaning behind it even though the movie was a comedy.
Lol, yeah Steve Correl is great.
I wish he has a bigger role in the film.

I think he and Jim could have switched roles and the movie would have still been
 great.
Did you think that Grace should have reconciled with Bruce?
Because I definitely don't.
I can agree with that. They both have similar comedy styles, although I think Steve does a bit more reality based comedy.
From a story perspective yes, but from real-world perspective no.
I'd say overall the movie is a solid watch and will be a classic
Thanks for chatting with me friend. It was a lot of fun!
I agree, regardless of critic ratings. It was nice chatting with you too!
Have a good one!

uid1response.feedback: Great chat partner, it was very fun to talk with them.

uid2response.feedback: This user was very easy to talk to!
